    A. Data Discovery and Retrieval B. Dataset Integration C. Comparison with CuratedAtlasQuery and cellxgene.census

C. Comparison with CuratedAtlasQuery and cellxgene.census

Source: vignettes/c_compare.Rmd
c_compare.Rmd

CuratedAtlasQuery

The R package CuratedAtlasQueryR contains independently curated CELLxGENE data sets. Start by installing the package

remotes::install_github("stemangiola/CuratedAtlasQueryR")

Load the library

library(CuratedAtlasQueryR)

Retrieve the (large) metadata file.

metadata <- get_metadata()

Query for cells from samples with ‘African’ ancestry, lung parenchyma tissue, assayed with 10x technology, and with cell type containing the string ‘CD4’.

single_cell_counts <-
    metadata |>
    dplyr::filter(
        ethnicity == "African" &
        stringr::str_like(assay, "%10x%") &
        tissue == "lung parenchyma" &
        stringr::str_like(cell_type, "%CD4%")
    )
single_cell_counts
#> # Source:   SQL [?? x 56]
#> # Database: DuckDB 0.8.1 [unknown@Linux 5.15.0-1041-azure:R 4.3.1/:memory:]
#>    cell_                 sample_ cell_type cell_type_harmonised confidence_class

    dplyr::count(dataset_id)

Retrieve the cells as a single-cell experiment

system.time({
    sce_caqr <-
        single_cell_counts |>
        get_single_cell_experiment()
})
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   2.452   0.348  21.704
sce_caqr
#> class: SingleCellExperiment 
#> dim: 36229 1571 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(36229): A1BG A1BG-AS1 ... ZZEF1 ZZZ3
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames(1571): ACAGCCGGTCCGTTAA_F02526_1 GGGAATGAGCCCAGCT_F02526_1 ...
#>   TACAACGTCAGCATTG_SC84_1 CATTCGCTCAATACCG_F02526_1
#> colData names(56): sample_ cell_type ... updated_at_y original_cell_id
#> reducedDimNames(0):
#> mainExpName: NULL
#> altExpNames(0):

The assay() data is a DelayedArray matrix of counts; the nature of the count is described in the sce_caqr$x_normalization column, but in this case is not informative.

class(SummarizedExperiment::assay(sce_caqr))
#> [1] "DelayedMatrix"
#> attr(,"package")
#> [1] "DelayedArray"
range(as(SummarizedExperiment::assay(sce_caqr), "sparseMatrix"))
#> [1] 0.000000 8.019915
sce_caqr |>
    SummarizedExperiment::colData() |>
    as.data.frame() |>
    dplyr::count(x_normalization)
#>   x_normalization    n
#> 1          custom 1571
library(CxGcensus)

The first time observation_data() is run, it creates a local database for efficient access. The database is created in ‘chunks’ to moderate memory consumption. The initial code here makes sure that memory consumption is modest.

description <- cellxgene.census::get_census_version_description("stable")
uri <- description$soma.uri
tiledbsoma_ctx <-
    cellxgene.census::new_SOMATileDBContext_for_census(description)
## chunk size, from Dirk Eddelbuettel, via slack
tiledbsoma_ctx$set("soma.init_buffer_bytes", as.character(1024**2 * 100))

homo <- observation_data(
    "homo_sapiens", uri = uri, tiledbsoma_ctx = tiledbsoma_ctx
)
homo
#> # Source:   table<obs> [?? x 21]
#> # Database: DuckDB 0.8.1 [unknown@Linux 5.15.0-1041-azure:R 4.3.1//home/runner/.cache/R/CxGcensus/1b1959c977e1.duckdb]
#>    soma_joinid dataset_id                 assay assay_ontology_term_id cell_type
#>        <int64> <chr>                      <chr> <chr>                  <chr>    
#>  1           0 9d8e5dca-03a3-457d-b7fb-8… 10x … EFO:0009922            myeloid …

obs_query <-
    homo |>
    filter(
        self_reported_ethnicity == "African", # 431882 cells
        tissue == "lung parenchyma",          # 189662 cells
        assay %LIKE% "%10x%",                 # 189662 cells
        cell_type %LIKE% "%CD4%"              # 3371
    )

obs_query |>
    count(dataset_id, is_primary_data)
#> # Source:   SQL [3 x 3]
#> # Database: DuckDB 0.8.1 [unknown@Linux 5.15.0-1041-azure:R 4.3.1//home/runner/.cache/R/CxGcensus/1b1959c977e1.duckdb]
#>   dataset_id                           is_primary_data       n
#>   <chr>                                <lgl>           <int64>
#> 1 9f222629-9e39-47d0-b83f-e08d610c7479 FALSE              1300
#> 2 9f222629-9e39-47d0-b83f-e08d610c7479 TRUE                500
#> 3 066943a2-fdac-4b29-b348-40cede398e4e FALSE              1571

obs_query_exact <-
    obs_query |>
    filter(dataset_id == "066943a2-fdac-4b29-b348-40cede398e4e") |>
    collect()
feat_query <-
    feature_data("homo_sapiens")
feat_query_approx <-
    feature_data("homo_sapiens") |>
    ## not all features are present -- SYMBOL is a very poor choice
    ## for identifier
    filter(feature_name %in% rownames(sce_caqr))
system.time({
    sce_cxg <-
        single_cell_experiment("homo_sapiens", feat_query, obs_query_exact)
})
#> creating axis and experiment queries
#> retrieving assay_data measurement 'RNA' collection 'X' layer 'raw' as a
#> sparse matrix with 60664 x 1571 distinct features x observations
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  46.755  16.000  90.026

cellxgene.census

cellxgene.census

The following is based on the cellxgene census R Quick Start. Load the package.

library(cellxgene.census)

Open a connection to the census as a ‘soma’ object, and retrieve a reference to the ’obs’ervation data.

soma <- open_soma(
    census_version = "2023-05-15", uri = uri, tiledbsoma_ctx = tiledbsoma_ctx
)
observation_data <- soma$get("census_data")$get("homo_sapiens")$get("obs")
observation_data

Discover available facets for filtering

observation_data$colnames()

Formulate a filter using the syntax of cellxgene.census

value_filter <- paste(
    "self_reported_ethnicity == 'African'",
    "tissue == 'lung parenchyma'",
    "cell_type == 'CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cell'",
    ## assay? any of "10x 5' v1", "10x 3' v2", "10x 3' v3"
    sep = " & "
)

Read the metadata associated with the query

system.time({
    observations <-
        observation_data$read(value_filter = value_filter)$concat() |>
        as.data.frame()                             # actually, tibble
})
observations
observations |>
    dplyr::count(dataset_id)

There are 1800 more cells and a second dataset; this is not because the filter did not include an ‘assay’ component; perhaps soma includes datasets that were not available when CuratedAtlasQueryR independently harmonized data, suspension_type, or to a hard-to-understand (for me!) classification as primary data (CuratedAtlasQueryR return only dataset 066943a2-fdac-4b29-b348-40cede398e4e)

observations |>
    count(dataset_id, suspension_type, is_primary_data)

cellxgene.census does not support representaton as SingleCellExperiment; retrieve the Seurat object corresponding to the observations we are interested in.

system.time({
    seurat <- cellxgene.census::get_seurat(
        census = soma,
        organism = "Homo sapiens",
        obs_value_filter = value_filter
    )
})
